intro: Sisymbrium gangeticum, commonly known as Indian mustard or wild radish, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants, and is characterized by its serrated leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
